page.title: 13PLUCKLEY GHOSTS 2
page.content: {THE WHITE LADY OF SURRENDEN MANOR}was in life the wife of a Lord Dering. Tragically she died at an early age, so great was her beauty that her grieving husband, was un able to bear the thought of her rotting in her grave, had her body embalmed and put in the family vault. The crypt was destroyed by fire in 1952 and that was when her ghost arose. {THE WHITE LADY OF ST. NICHOLAS CHURCH} was also the wife of a Lord Dering some 500 years ago. She too was a lady of exquisite beauty and her husband had her body preserved in a series of lead coffins placed inside an oaken cask. Her ghost wanders close to the vault in which she was placed.
